newsitem.title: JAPAN: Kobe rubber futures rise in after-hours trade.
newsitem.headline: Kobe rubber futures rise in after-hours trade.

text.p: Kobe rubber futures were higher across the board on Tuesday, supported by talk that the Thai government bought rubber in Thailand to prop up weakening prices, traders said.
Prices ranged from unchanged to 0.8 yen per kg firmer than the day's close. Most-active benchmark July was up 0.6 yen at 148.5 yen. Volume was 4,105 lots.
"Expectations that overseas prices are set to rise, are spreading in the market, helped by talk of intervention by the Thai government," one trader said.
